title: Victor Talking Machines ID
content:
Hi,

I’m trying to identify the typefaces used for the 81, Owens & Beers, Victor, and Talking Machines/Records & Supplies in this picture. I think I can find a close equivalent for the 81 and Talking Machines... but am at a loss regarding the Owens, Beers, and Victore.

Any help is greatly appreciated. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/-1_4337.jpg)
author: AJM

comments.content: This looks like a fairly old image. I’m guessing that it is old and that those are all lettered. You can find a lot of similar fonts at [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/viewallfonts/).

See also [Grand Central](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/grand_central/) and other [glyphic titling faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/titling_thorn_serif/) for something akin to the serif lettering. [Herald Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/herald_gothic/) and [Regency Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090522121640/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/stylus/regency_gothic/) for the sans.
